The Perfect Expedition Monster
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher Advance 2 Archive (GameBoy Advance): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here): The Perfect Expedition Monster
By Magnus on Thursday, December 22, 2005 - 04:16 am:

Well, I've been experimenting with Dragons. I'm a HUGE Dragon Breed fan, so I've raised about up to... 4-5 Dragons, maybe? So far, I have Ragnaroks (combined Monol and Dragon,l but cannot use him yet, since I froze him, Diaboros, which is my MASTER ranked Dragon, whose 4 of his skills are over 700 now. Sovereign, which is my XtalDragon. And Slythe, which is the name of my Diva Dragon.

Erm, now I'll skip all the boring junk.

I was carefully looking into some of the topics on MR2. I believe GoldenBoy or someone else stated that a monster with over 500 LIF, and has about 999INT would become a "suitable" monster for Expeditions, yes?

So, I raised my Dragon STRAIGHT TO Rank A. When it was a baby Dragon, I always made it it Hard Drills repeatedly. (I'm going to go straight tio the point)

After 3 yrs of doing NOTHING but Hard Drills that boosted up Int and Lif, and battling in Official Ranked Tournaments, E, D, C, and B. I finally got it to A Rank.

So, now it's Lif and Int is at exactly at 999. >.<;

So, I saved the game. I went to Promiase to do an Expedition, I'm not sure if you guys already know this. But if your life is 700, that's ALL you need for an Expedition as I have just found out recently. (That's how many steps you can walk during an Expedition, so there's no point in raising it any higher, but I didn't know that until I raised my Dragon's LIF and INT to max)

Since it max Lif and Int, I began searching in buildings, and guess what? Even monsters with 999INT can get lost "easily".

And, most of the time, which is about 70%, it seems to be able to find items and encounter enemies.

The other 30%, it gets lost. So I guess you could say this is the "best" that an Expedition Monster can do, right? *nods and shrugs* I guess so.

Other than that, when my XtalDragon (who I call Sovereign) reached Yr 4, it also received a warning, saying that it needs to be retired, etc.

If you have any other questions, fell free to post them here. As my for Expedition Monster, the other stats were under 300. Except Def, which is over 700.

So, it was a Tank-monster. XD That's all I have found out, during my experiment.

By Seize on Thursday, December 22, 2005 - 07:39 am:

I had a 500 INT, 999 LIF Lesione and probably posted the recommendation, for 500 LIF and 999 INT instead, that you remembered, for just that reason.

This is just a theory but:
I went exploring with a maxed golem and had great success with items and not getting lost.
I explored every building (clockwise, starting near the start) on the map. I would continue searching a building until he returned empty handed once and then would move on to the next bulding. Goldenboy had recommended moving on more frequently to prevent getting lost (not trying to put words in his mouth).

I'm NOT saying if a monster returns empty handed they will get lost or there isn't anything left to find. That is not true.

I haven't tried the Observer trait yet but thats supposed to help. I helped contribute where to find items on the maps and that should help also.

By Magnus on Thursday, December 22, 2005 - 07:46 am:

Ah, Observer trait, is it? I'll keep that in mind, thank you very much for that info, it shall prove to be very helpful to me.

By Lil_Literalist on Tuesday, December 19, 2006 - 09:50 am:

Observer trait doesn't keep you from getting lost, or finding things more often. It lets you find rarer things. For example, there's a temple in Malkt that gives mint candy for the most part, I believe. With my Arrowhead with observer, though, I got mint candies, luck stars, def charms, and some various stones. It really stinks when your monster gets lost after getting all those items, though.

And the perfect expedition monster would be maxed out in every stat, have some good combat traits, and the obsever trait. =P
